greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest multiple of n using only digits 0 and 7.
comment: a(n) = min{A204094(k): k > 0 and A204094(k) mod n = 0}. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 10 2012]
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..998
mathematica: With[{c=Rest[FromDigits/@Tuples[{0,7},11]]},Table[SelectFirst[c, Divisible[ #,n]&],{n,40}]] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 27 2019 *)
program: a078246 n = head [x | x <- tail a204094_list, mod x n == 0]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 23 2002
